overview: From 2025-07-29 to 2025-07-30, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-service: Event Call Graph
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
Add a logic to "trace" the event flow.
For example, when `ReceivedBlockEvent` event is emitted, we get a below call trace in the happy path scenario.
```
p2p.ReceivedBlockEvent [09ab623c]
└── clsync.ReceivedUnsafePayloadEvent [9277ffe6]
    └── engine.ForkchoiceRequestEvent [aca04240]
        └── engine.ForkchoiceUpdateEvent [e024a814]
            └── engine.ProcessUnsafePayloadEvent [78c3546d]
                ├── engine.UnsafeUpdateEvent [c5a17e39]
                │   ├── engine.PromoteCrossUnsafeEvent [a67127ca]
                │   │   └── engine.CrossUnsafeUpdateEvent [0e2159d5]
                │   └── engine.TryUpdateEngineEvent [a40cff76]
                └── engine.ForkchoiceUpdateEvent [ba5224e4]
```

topPRs.title: op-node, op-devstack: initial execution multiplexing
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This PR is adding support for op-node to run multiple execution engines for a given chain.

Design document at: https://www.notion.so/oplabs/Execution-Multiplexing-Specific-Implementation-and-Plan-23af153ee1628051a7e4ece97fff689e

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/16822

topPRs.title: Go implementation updates for CWIA creator pattern
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Update a lot of the op-deployer go code to handle the updated fault dispute game deployment. Not sure what's left because there are still warnings in the contracts which causes the build to fail before it gets to actually running the go tests. The ones I've run locally are now passing though.

**Tests**

Some unit tests are still commented out - need to work out what they were actually testing and move them to the right place.

**Additional context**

Builds on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16340

topContributors.summary: ajsutton: Today, ajsutton focused on a significant Go implementation update for the CWIA creator pattern, reflected in the open PR ethereum-optimism/optimism#16869, which involved modifying 35 files with a net reduction of 118 lines. Their code changes were primarily split between tests and other work, indicating a balanced approach to development and quality assurance.
nonsense: Focused on foundational development for execution multiplexing, opening a significant PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#16873) to introduce this new capability.

pcw109550: Focused on foundational improvements by creating an issue to track the "op-service: Event Call Graph" (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16874), indicating an interest in system architecture and observability.
